paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRv) with axonal polyneuropathy

individual_records.evidence_sentence: 21 (55%) ATTRv subjects had axonal polyneuropathy (15 men; mean age 63.9; mean BMI 25.2, 17 FAP stage 1, 4 FAP stage 2).
17 subjects (45%) were pre-symptomatic carriers (7 men; mean age 53.5; mean BMI 27.0).

functional_data.summary: Nerve ultrasound evaluation showed progressive brachial plexus enlargement.

variants.segregation_data: Segregation with disease in families not explicitly mentioned.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical presentation and ultrasound findings.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the importance of brachial plexus CSA as a potential biomarker for disease progression.
key_quotes: Brachial plexus CSA may candidate as longitudinal biomarker of peripheral nerve involvement in ATTRv.

tables_processed.table_caption: Demographic data of the study cohort
Delta CSA data of the two groups (ATTRv-PN and carriers).

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward with clear data on TTR variants and penetrance.
